title: What Are War Crimes? What to Know as Ukraine Accuses Russia
sub_head: It is unlikely Russian President Vladimir Putin will be arrested for war crimes, at least not while he is still in power
body:
Russia’s invasion of Ukraine is raising questions over whether President Vladimir Putin or his commanders will be charged with war crimes. It’s a complex legal issue, compounded in part by the fact that Russia, along with the U.S. and China, isn’t a party to the International Criminal Court, which usually hears war-crime cases at its headquarters in the Netherlands.
ICC prosecutor Karim Khan on Feb. 28 said he would begin an investigation into violations, based on Ukraine’s previously agreeing to its jurisdiction there.
